content:
• Thursday, August 11, 2016
  • CHTR

    Charter +1.6% as Deutsche Bank boosts price target

    • Charter Communications (NASDAQ:CHTR) gained 1.6% today and inched closer to Tuesday's post-earnings 52-week high as Deutsche Bank raised its price target on shares.
    • The firm reiterated its Buy rating and boosted its target from $285 to $300, implying 16% upside.
    • "We find CHTR to be an attractive multi-year FCF growth story combined with a levered capital structure, a combination that should generate a mid-teens annual compounded return on the share price through 2021 off of our $300 PT," writes DB's Bryan Kraft. He raised EBITDA estimates for the next three years by about 2%, driven by lower expenses and growing revenues.
    • In Tuesday's earnings, Charter beat expectations on top and bottom lines and raised video revenue despite another decline in customers. And free cash flow more than tripled Y/Y to $524M.
    • Also after earnings, Pivotal Research raised its own price target on Charter, to $290 from $285.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • ORIG

    Ocean Rig warns of potential bankruptcy, shares -54% AH

    • Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG) -54.6% AH despite easily beating Q2 earnings and revenue expectations, as it warns that it is exploring restructuring alternatives, including "a possible reorganization under U.S. bankruptcy laws or another jurisdiction."
    • As market conditions remain "extremely negative," ORIG says "it is evident [that] debt obligations will need to be amended or exchanged for new debt and/or equity securities, and some debt holders may have little or no recovery on their investment."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 21 Comments

    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: VJET -18.6%. RT -6.7%. SAEX -3.8%. DDS -3.5%. VIAV -3.1%.

  • DK

    NY Post: Icahn-controlled CVR Energy preparing offer to buy Delek

    • Delek US (NYSE:DK) +12.8% AH following a NY Post report that Carl Icahn-controlled refiner CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI) is planning to make an offer for the company; CVI +9.2% AH.
    • The report also speculates that Icahn, who sits on DK’s board, is building a personal stake in the company.
    • Refiners have been hurt this year by narrowing oil spreads plus the rising price of RINs; DK has lost 39% and CVI has shed 65% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • SGI

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise to buy Silicon Graphics for $275M

    • Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI) +27.9% AH after agreeing to be acquired by Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) for ~$275M, or $7.75/share in cash, a 30% premium to today's closing price.
    • HPE says the deal will enhance its data analytics and high-performance computing operations.
    • The announcement came as SGI posted better than expected Q2 earnings on 20% lower revenues Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 16 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia posts strong Q2 and rises to a more than 150% gain on the year

    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) realizes 24% Y/Y and 9% sequential ($1.43B) revenue growth.
    • Operating expenses increased 6% while operating income, net income and diluted EPS grew 65%, 65% and 56% on a Y/Y basis, respectively.
    • GPU Business revenue increased 25% and Tegra Processor Business grew 30% over the year-ago period.
    • Gaming, Professional Visualization, Datacenter and Automotive platforms revenue increased 18%, 22%, 110% and 68% Y/Y, respectively. OEM and IP revenue declined 6% Y/Y.
    • Introduced first four constituents of Pascal-based gaming GPUs and revealed Quadro P6000 workstation GPU.
    • Projects Q3 revenue of $1.68B (+/- 2%), gross margins of 57.8%-58% (+/- 50 basis points), operating expenses of $465M, tax rate of 21% (+/- 1%) and capital expenditures of $35M-$45M.
    • Share repurchases of $509M in H1 2017, $124M of cash dividends. Next dividend of $0.115 per share payable on September 16 to shareholders of record on August 25.
    • CEO Jen-Hsun Huang: "Strong demand for our new Pascal-generation GPUs and surging interest in deep learning drove record results. Our strategy to focus on creating the future where graphics, computer vision and artificial intelligence converge is fueling growth across our specialized platforms -- Gaming, Pro Visualization, Datacenter and Automotive. We are more excited than ever about the impact of deep learning and AI, which will touch every industry and market. We have made significant investments over the past five years to evolve our entire GPU computing stack for deep learning. Now, we are well positioned to partner with researchers and developers all over the world to democratize this powerful technology and invent its future."
    • Shares are up nearly 3% in extended trading, more than 65% on a 3-month basis and over 150% on a 1-year basis.
    • Conference call
    • Quarterly revenue trend
    • CFO commentary
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 51 Comments
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

  • PBFX

    PBF Logistics to buy 50% stake in Torrance Valley Pipeline for $175M

    • PBF Logistics (NYSE:PBFX) agrees to acquire a 50% interest in Torrance Valley Pipeline from an affiliate of PBF Energy (NYSE:PBF) for ~$175M.
    • Torrance Valley owns the 189-mile San Joaquin Valley Pipeline system in California with a throughput capacity of ~110K bbl/day and comprised of the primary crude gathering and transportation lines that supply PBF Energy's Torrance refinery.
    • To help fund the deal, PBFX announces a 4M-unit public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 600K common units.
    • PBFX -3%, PBF +0.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • AMDA

    Amedica misses by $0.09, misses on revenue

    • Amedica (NASDAQ:AMDA): Q2 EPS of -$0.40 misses by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $4M (-16.3% Y/Y) misses by $0.2M.
    • Shares +5.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom +18% on the day including AH earnings rip

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) rallies after topping estimates with its Q2 report.
    • Total sales were down 0.2% during the quarter, while comparable store sales fell 1.2%,
    • A high level of markdowns to clear inventory dragged gross profit rate down 101 bps to 34.3%. SG&A expenses were higher as a percentage of sales due to sales deleverage. Still, new cost controls limited the damage compared to expectations.
    • Nordstrom ended the quarter with 28.826M square feet of space, up 4.6% Y/Y. The company's retail footprint could be a topic of discussion on the Nordstrom earnings call after Macy's announced earlier in the day a 15% cut in full-line stores.
    • Previously: Nordstrom beats by $0.11, misses on revenue (Aug. 11)
    • JWN +11.19% AH to $52.88 to follow on a 7.5% gain during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 6 Comments

    Ruby Tuesday dives after unleashing plan to close 95 stores

    • Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT) tumbles 12% in AH trading after unleashing a plan to close 95 underforming stores.
    • The company's Fresh Start Initiative includes a comprehensive asset rationalization analysis.
    • Q2 results from the restaurant operator were disappointing, including a painful 3.7% drop in comparable store sales.
    • Previously: Ruby Tuesday misses by $0.01, misses on revenue (Aug. 11)

  • TTI

    TETRA Tech started at Overweight by Morgan Stanley

    • TETRA Technologies (TTI +4.9%) is initiated with an Overweight rating and a $10 price target at Morgan Stanley, which says the shares do not reflect the company’s longer-term free cash flow generation potential and the cyclical upside from onshore and short-cycle offshore exposure.
    • Although the offshore industry likely will remain sluggish through 2017, TTI’s short-cycle offshore exposure offers “a good way to play an out-of-consensus theme,” Stanley says.
    • The firm mentions some upcoming catalysts that could unlock TTI’s underlying value, including possible resolution of balance sheet concerns at TTI’s compression MLP, greater market confidence in distribution sustainability, and the potential sale of the company’s offshore services business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • FOX

    WSJ: Fox anticipating settlements as women come forward in Ailes probe

    • Controversy around Roger Ailes and his tenure at the helm of Fox News (FOX +1.2%, FOXA +1.8%) isn't letting up, as women coming forward in a sexual-harassment investigation now number in the double digits and the company is anticipating settlements, The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • Many women have come forward with stories about Ailes' behavior since former anchor Gretchen Carlson sued for sexual harassment and wrongful termination in early July after a June termination. Ailes later resigned under pressure, and Carlson is reportedly headed toward an eight-figure settlement in her case.
    • A key issue will be whether the alleged behavior stops with Ailes or whether others at the network enabled it, depending on how they handled any complaints they received.
    • Compliance and management issues have been raised around a 2011 settlement for $3.15M that former Fox News employee Laurie Luhn received that the network's parent at the time, News Corp., says it was unaware of. Luhn told investigators she had been harassed by Ailes for more than 20 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • CORR

    CorEnergy Infrastructure downgraded at Stifel on lease concern

    • CorEnergy Infrastructure Trust (CORR -2.3%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Stifel, citing lease uncertainty related to the Pinedale situation.
    • Stifel notes that CORR posted a solid Q2 with AFFO of $13.3 million and DPU coverage of 1.5x, both in-line with its estimates, and provided an update on the bankruptcy proceedings related to tenants at the GIGS and Pinedale assets.
    • CORR expects to know whether the Pinedale lease will be rejected by year-end, while the GIGS lease looks increasingly secure as the parent for the tenant recently filed its reorganization plan that excludes any mention of the lease.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 14 Comments

  • LYB

    Lyondell's Houston refinery said to return to normal operations

    • LyondellBasell (LYB +2.7%) reportedly has returned to normal operations at its 263K bbl/day Houston refinery after a power interruption on a unit cut production in half.
    • Due to a quick restart of the sulfur recovery unit after losing power on Tuesday, the refinery's production reportedly is expected to return to full capacity within a few days.
    • The refinery's production averaged just 73% of capacity during Q2 due to extensive repairs to a coking unit damaged in an April fire, and the refinery was not able to run at full production until the coker restarted on July 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips seen trying to “put money into shareholders’ pockets”

    • ConocoPhillips (COP +2.2%) wins some love from RBC analysts who say the company plans to return 20%-30% of operating cash flow to shareholders, in addition to dividends and share buybacks, as it seeks to "put money into shareholders' pockets."
    • RBC estimates that the current dividend alone would reach the target in 2016. but for 2017 at its forecast $59/bbl oil, COP has more room for options; the firm expects a ~4% dividend increase with capacity for a $500M share buyback.
    • RBC also notes that COP has a significant and highly economic medium-cycle project inventory that it believes the market "does not quite appreciate, such as CD5 in Alaska."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 24 Comments
  • SSRI

    Silver Standard surges on Q2 earnings beat, lower cost guidance

    • Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +12.2%) rallies to a new 52-week high after Q2 earnings and revenues beat analyst expectations thanks to strong cost reduction efforts.
    • SSRI reduces cash cost guidance for its Marigold mine in Nevada to $650-$700/oz. of gold sold after producing more than 47K oz. during Q2 at cash costs of $663/oz., and at the Pirquitas mine in Argentina to $9-$10/oz. of silver after producing 2.5M oz. during Q2 at $8.87/oz.; the company also raises its annual production guidance of Pirquitas for the second time this year to 9M-10N oz. of silver.
    • SSRI says Q2 Marigold production was lower Q/Q because of planned ore stacking at higher elevations on the leach pads, but expects higher Q3 and Q4 production vs. H1 as the new leach pad is commissioned and the full impact of additional haul trucks is realized.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment

  • NYMX

    Nymox readies marketing application for BPH drug fexapotide; shares up 31%

    • Micro cap Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +31.4%) perks up on more than a 12x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it expects to file a marketing application (presumably in the U.S.) within the next two quarters seeking approval of fexapotide for the treatment of men with an enlarged prostate, called benign prostate hyperplasia or BPH. In addition, the company says it does not envision needing more cash for the pre-marketing development of fexapotide (it will need new capital for commercialization, though). It intends to partner with a larger company once fexapotide is approved, provided satisfactory terms can be agreed upon.
    • Fexapotide is administered directly into the prostate via a transrectal injection that does not require anesthesia or sedation. Results from long-term studies (seven years of follow-up) showed a prostate cancer incidence rate of only 1.3% in men treated with fexapotide compared to ~23% in the general population and ~20% in men treated with PDE5 inhibitors for erectile dysfunction [Pfizer's (NYSE:PFE) Viagra, Eli Lilly's (NYSE:LLY) Cialis, Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) and GlaxoSmithKline's (NYSE:GSK) Levitra].
    • Previously: Nymox's lead product candidate reduces incidence of prostate cancer in long-term study; shares up 29% (June 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 7 Comments

  • AEMD

    Aethlon's biofiltration device shows ability to clear Zika virus; shares up 29%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aethlon Medical (AEMD +29.4%) heads north on a 34x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 766K shares, in response to its announcement of encouraging results from laboratory studies assessing the efficacy of its Hemopurifier product in removing Zika virus from biological fluids.
    • In vitro studies conducted with small-scale versions of Hemopurifier showed the device cleared 95% of Zika virus from cell culture fluid in five and half hours and 50% from human blood serum in five hours. The Zika strain tested is the one currently causing problems in Puerto Rico and may be the  one behind the first U.S. infections.
    • The Hemopurifier targets the broad-spectrum elimination of viruses, bacterial toxins and immunosuppressive proteins from the blood.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • WPM

    Silver Wheaton raises gold outlook following record Q2 production

    • Silver Wheaton (SLW +2.9%) shares run to their highest levels in three years after posting in-line Q2 earnings on a 29% Y/Y revenue increase to a better than expected $212M.
    • SLW raises its one-year and long-term gold production guidance, now seeing attributable gold production of 305K oz., up from its previous outlook for 265K oz., and average attributable gold production over the next five years including 2016 of 330K oz./year, up from 260K oz.
    • Silver production for 2016 is seen at 32M oz., down from previous guidance of 32.8M oz. due to lower than expected production from the San Dimas and Peñasquito mines; SLW sees annual silver production during 2016-20 remaining unchanged at 31M oz./year.
    • SLW says H1 attributable silver sales volumes hit a record 14.7M oz., up 31% Y/Y, while gold sales also reached a record 136K oz. for H1, up 52% Y/Y.
    • Operating cash flows for Q1 and H1 were a respective $134M and $248M, 23% and 25% higher than the respective periods during 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM

  • Energy sector leads stocks higher

    • A 3.6% gain for crude oil on the back of bullish words from the IEA and Saudi Arabia has helped send the XLE higher by 1.5%, which in turn is leading the S&P 500's 0.5% advance. The Nasdaq is also up 0.5%; the Dow 0.7%.
    • ETFs: XLE, VDE, ERX, OIH, XOP, ERY, DIG, DUG, BGR, XES, IYE, IEO, FENY, IEZ, PXE, FIF, PXJ, RYE, NDP, GUSH, DRIP, DDG, FXN, CRAK, SOP, UOP, NANR, ERGF, JHME, ERYY

  • Big move for oil on IEA report; Saudi chatter

    • Crude production is falling behind demand to the tune of 1M barrels per day in Q3, says the IEA. "Our balances show essentially no oversupply during the second half of the year."
    • It's a combination of big production cuts by non-OPEC producers and healthy demand.
    • In other news, Saudi Arabia energy minister Khalid al-Falih says market forces are already doing their work, but his country is ready to do what it can to further support prices.
    • WTI crude is higher by 3.6% to $43.22 per barrel. USO +3.95%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWTI, UCO, DWTI, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, OILD, OILX, OILU
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 57 Comments
  • BHP

    Australia to pay BHP Billiton $170M to buy back coal exploration permit

    • Australia's New South Wales state agrees to pay BHP Billiton (BHP +2.2%) A$220M (US$170M) to buy back a coal exploration licesce that extends under prime farmland.
    • The state government said it decided that coal mining under the fertile black soil plains posed too great an environmental risk.
    • The agreement relates to a commercial exploration license in the state's northeast, at Caroona, for underground coal mining covering ~344 sq. km; BHP bought the license for A$100M in 2006.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM

    Concordia shares Valeant's pain, shares down 3%

    • The selling in Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -8.9%) appears to be rippling out to Concordia Healthcare (CXRX-OLD -2.5%), a company with a similar business model of acquiring off-patent drugs and hiking prices. Shares have lost over 80% of their value in less than a year.

  • UNIT

    CS&L down 2.8% following Q2 earnings

    • Communications Sales & Leasing (CSAL) has fallen 2.8% following its Q2 report which included EPS that beat expectations and revenues that rose more than 46%.
    • The company lost $0.02/share on a reported basis (net loss of $1.5M); adjusted EPS of $0.06 edged expectations by a penny.
    • The company's PEG Bandwidth acquisition added $13.8M in revenues and $5.5M in adjusted EBITDA after its closing date May 2.
    • Liquidity at quarter's end came to $49M in unrestricted cash and cash equivalents and $458M in borrowing capacity under a revolving credit facility; leverage ratio was 5.6 times (net debt to annualized adjusted EBITDA).
    • Conference call coming at 11 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 6 Comments
  • CC

    Chemours on the move

    • Chemours (CC +6.1%) shares are on the rise again following yesterday's upgrade from Argus after the company's strong Q2 earnings.
    • The firm raised its rating on shares to Buy from Hold with a $13 price target, stating Chemours "has significant competitive advantages" and has a "favorable" valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 3 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo +4% as ancillary Alibaba trading vehicle

    • Alibaba (BABA) is gaining (+5.67%) since posting strong Q2 results this morning and Yahoo (YHOO +3.8%) is following suit.
    • Yahoo's recent deal with Verizon involved core assets and real estate while maintaining its 15% investment in Alibaba.
    • Yahoo is up more than 9% on a 1-month basis, over 10% on a 3-month basis and is currently trading at its highest point in more than a year, up 15% on a 1-year basis.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 23 Comments

    Franklin Street Properties -6.1% after pricing secondary

    • The cost of equity capital is likely a little more expensive than hoped as Franklin Street Properties (NYSEMKT:FSP) prices its 6.125M share secondary at $12.35 each for gross proceeds of $72.1M. The underwriters still have an option to buy another 918.75K shares at that price.
    • Proceeds will be used to fund the $45.5M purchase of Pershing Park Plaza in Atlanta, and for the $15M-$20M redevelopment of a Minneapolis property.

  • TPB

    Turning Point Brands rallies after earnings

    • Turning Point Brands (TPB +8.2%) rallies after reporting Q2 results.

    • Shares of TPB traded at $9.96 at last check, just below the $10 mark where the IPO priced.
    • Previously: Turning Point Brands reports Q2 results (Aug. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • ITRN

    More on Ituran Location's Q2

    • Ituran Location (ITRN +4.3%) reports revenue rose 23% after excluding the exchange rate impact in Q2.

    • Net subscriber +27K in the quarter.
    • Subscriber base +15.1% Y/Y to 1,012K.

  • UAA

    Under Armour higher after announcing management moves

    • Under Armour (NYSE:UA) announces it promoted Kip Fulks to the position of Chief Product Officer and Andy Donkin as Chief Marketing Officer.

    • SEC Form 8-K
    • Shares of UA are up 3.47% to $40.44 amid a broad rally in the retail sector.

  • AVGR

    Avinger prices equity offering; shares slump 17%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Avinger (AVGR -16.7%) drops on triple normal volume in response to its announcement that it has priced its public offering of 8.572M common shares at $3.50. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 1,285,800 shares. Closing date is August 16. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
    • Yesterday's close was $4.62.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • AEO

    Chain store stocks soar after Macy's lops off 15% of store base

    • The retail sector is racking up sizable gains after Macy's set the table with a major store closing announcement (15% of full-line stores).
    • Earnings beats at Macy's and Kohl's, along with a surprise upgrade on American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +4.6%) are also helping to boost sentiment.
    • Notable gainers include Guess (GES +4.3%), Dillard's (DDS +5.8%), Ascena Retail Group (ASNA +4.6%), Stage Stores (SSI +7.7%), Sears Holdings (SHLD +4.6%), Gap (GPS +3.5%), Abercombie & Fitch (ANF +3.2%), Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.2%), Urban Outfitters (URBN +1.3%), Francesca's (FRAN +2.5%), DSW (DSW +3.5%), Pier 1 Imports (PIR +4%), and Finish Line (FINL +2.4%).
    • The S&P 500 Retail ETF (NYSEARCA:XRT) is up 2.1% on the day off the chain store buzz.

    • Macy's (NYSE:M) reports comparable sale on an owned plus licensed basis fell 2% in Q2.
